seafood.title: Lemon Herb Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss vegetables with half the olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a large baking sheet.
Place salmon on the same sheet or a separate one. Brush with remaining olive oil.
Mix lemon juice, zest, oregano, and thyme. Pour over salmon and vegetables.
Roast for 15-20 minutes until salmon flakes easily and vegetables are tender.

seafood.title: Mediterranean Tuna and Vegetable Pasta
ingredients: 12 oz rice pasta or corn pasta
2 cans (5 oz each) tuna in olive oil
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water before draining.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add cherry tomatoes and cook for 3-4 minutes until softened.
Add tuna (with oil), olives, capers, and spinach. Cook until spinach wilts.
Add cooked pasta and toss. Add pasta water if needed for consistency.
Finish with lemon juice, basil, salt, and pepper.

seafood.title: Herb-Crusted White Fish
ingredients: 4 white fish fillets (cod or halibut, 6 oz each)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss potatoes and carrots with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes.
Mix crushed crackers with herbs, remaining olive oil, and lemon juice.
Season fish with salt and pepper. Press herb mixture onto fish fillets.
Add fish to the pan with vegetables and roast for 12-15 minutes until fish flakes easily.

red_meat.title: Greek-Style Lamb with Feta and Tomatoes
ingredients: 8 lamb chops or 2 lbs leg of lamb, cut into portions
4 large tomatoes, cut into thick slices
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season lamb with salt, pepper, oregano, and rosemary.
Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in an oven-safe pan over medium-high heat.
Sear lamb for 2-3 minutes per side until browned.
Arrange tomato slices around lamb, drizzle with remaining olive oil and lemon juice.
Transfer to oven and roast for 15-20 minutes for medium doneness.
Top with crumbled feta in the last 5 minutes of cooking.

red_meat.title: Italian Beef and Zucchini Bake
ingredients: 4 large zucchini, sliced lengthwise into 1/4-inch strips
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brown ground beef in a large pan, breaking it up as it cooks. Season with salt, pepper, and oregano.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in fresh basil.
Meanwhile, brush zucchini slices with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Layer half the zucchini in a greased 9×13 baking dish.
Spread meat sauce over zucchini, then layer remaining zucchini on top.
Top with mozzarella and bake for 35-40 minutes until bubbly and golden.

red_meat.title: Steak with Herb Butter and Grilled Vegetables
ingredients: 4 ribeye or sirloin steaks (8 oz each)
2 red bell peppers, cut into strips
instructions: Mix softened butter with herbs and lemon zest. Set aside.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush vegetables with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Grill vegetables for 4-5 minutes per side until tender with grill marks.
Season steaks with salt and pepper. Grill for 4-6 minutes per side for medium-rare.
Let steaks rest for 5 minutes, then top with herb butter before serving.

red_meat.title: Spanish-Style Beef and Potato Skillet
ingredients: 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Brown beef cubes on all sides, about 8 minutes total. Season with salt and pepper.
Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add bell peppers, tomatoes, and paprika. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook for 25-30 minutes until beef is tender and potatoes are cooked through.
Stir in manchego cheese just before serving.

red_meat.title: Mediterranean Meatballs with Parmesan
ingredients: 1/2 cup rice breadcrumbs (or finely ground rice crackers)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Mix ground meats, breadcrumbs, egg, parsley, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Form into 1.5-inch meatballs and place on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat crushed tomatoes in a large pan and season with salt and pepper.
Add meatballs to the sauce and simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve topped with grated parmesan.

red_meat.title: Pork Tenderloin with Olive Tapenade
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
For tapenade: pulse olives, capers, 2 tbsp olive oil, and lemon juice in a food processor until chunky.
Toss root vegetables with remaining olive oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 20 minutes.
Season pork with salt and pepper. Sear in an oven-safe pan for 2-3 minutes per side.
Transfer to oven and roast for 15-20 minutes until internal temperature reaches 145°F.
Let rest 5 minutes, then slice and serve with tapenade and crumbled goat cheese.

chicken.title: Chicken Thighs with Olives and Tomatoes
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and oregano.
Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe pan over medium-high heat.
Brown chicken thighs skin-side down for 5-6 minutes until crispy.
Flip chicken and add tomatoes and olives around the pan.
Transfer to oven and roast for 25-30 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
Drizzle with lemon juice before serving.

chicken.title: Mediterranean Chicken and Rice Skillet
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken thighs, cut into pieces
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Brown chicken pieces and season with salt and pepper. Remove and set aside.
Add rice to the same pan and stir for 2 minutes until lightly toasted.
Add broth, tomatoes, and saffron. Bring to a boil.
Return chicken to pan, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
Let stand 5 minutes, then top with feta and parsley.

chicken.title: Grilled Chicken with Caprese Salad
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper. Grill for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through.
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on plates, alternating.
Add sliced chicken and fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar just before serving.

chicken.title: Chicken and Vegetable Casserole with Parmesan
ingredients: 2 lbs chicken thighs, cut into pieces
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss chicken and vegetables with olive oil, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Arrange in a large baking dish.
Roast for 30 minutes, then sprinkle with parmesan.
Continue roasting for 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.

chicken.title: Spanish Chicken with Peppers and Manchego
ingredients: 3 red bell peppers, cut into strips
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe pan over medium-high heat.
Season chicken with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Brown chicken skin-side down for 5-6 minutes until crispy.
Flip chicken and add peppers around the pan.
Add white wine and transfer to a 375°F oven.
Roast for 25 minutes, then add manchego cheese and roast 5 more minutes.

chicken.title: Herb-Roasted Whole Chicken
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Pat chicken dry and season inside and out with salt and pepper.
Stuff cavity with lemon quarters and half the herbs.
Rub skin with olive oil and remaining herbs.
Surround with vegetables and drizzle with lemon juice.
Roast for 60-75 minutes until internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Let rest 10 minutes before carving.

chicken.title: Chicken Saltimbocca Style
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Top each breast with 2 sage leaves and 2 slices prosciutto. Secure with toothpicks.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken prosciutto-side down for 4-5 minutes until crispy.
Flip and cook 3-4 minutes more until chicken is cooked through.
Add wine to deglaze pan, scraping up any browned bits.
Sprinkle with parmesan before serving.

vegetarian.title: Quinoa Tabbouleh (Modified)
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package directions and let cool completely.
Combine quinoa with tomatoes, cucumber, herbs, and green onion tops.
Whisk together olive oil and lemon juice.
Toss salad with dressing and season with salt and pepper.
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.

vegetarian.title: Grilled Eggplant and Red Pepper Salad
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Grill whole peppers until charred all over, about 12 minutes total.
Grill eggplant for 4-5 minutes per side until tender.
Place peppers in a bowl and cover with plastic wrap for 10 minutes.
Peel, seed, and slice peppers into strips.
Arrange eggplant and peppers on a platter.
Drizzle with balsamic vinegar, sprinkle with pine nuts, feta, and basil.

vegetarian.title: Herb & Vegetable Rice Pilaf
ingredients: ½ red capsicum (bell pepper), finely diced
2¾ cups low-FODMAP beef or vegetable stock
Greek or natural yogurt (lactose-free if required), to serve
instructions: Heat oils in a non-stick heavy-based saucepan with a tightly fitting lid.
Sauté eggplant, capsicum and zucchini over high heat for about 5 minutes or until they start to brown.
Add spices and cook for a couple more minutes. You can also add some chilli if you like.
Add rice and briefly sauté, then add boiling stock. Stir constantly for another 10 minutes.

Cover with the tightly fitting lid and either bake in a preheated 180°C/356°F oven (160°C/320°F fan-forced) for 30 minutes OR keep on the stove, reduce the heat to very low and cook for 30 minutes or until water absorbed.
Remove from oven or stove and let sit with lid on for 15 minutes.
Uncover, cool slightly and stir through basil and chives.
Serve with a dollop of yogurt and a squeeze of lemon.
